intro: Chaetospora axillaris f. terrestris, commonly known as the groundsel or common groundsel, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm, with a mat-forming growth habit. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish to brownish composite flowers arranged in clusters. It is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and meadows. Its botanical characteristics make it adaptable to a variety of environmental conditions.
